content.text: function is a scalar function in Microsoft SQL Server designed to obfuscate or mask sensitive account numbers. This function takes an account number as input and returns a masked version of it, ensuring that only a portion of the account number is visible, while the rest is replaced with a masking character, such as an asterisk (*). This is commonly used to protect sensitive information in applications where full account numbers should not be exposed.

function is low. Scalar functions perform simple operations on input values and return a single value. The logic involved in masking an account number is straightforward, involving string manipulation functions to replace certain characters with a mask.
The function has the following input parameters:

(Data Type: VARCHAR or NVARCHAR): This parameter represents the account number that needs to be masked. It is the primary input for the function, and its purpose is to provide the sensitive data that requires obfuscation.

function is a string data type, such as VARCHAR or NVARCHAR. The structure of the return value is a masked version of the input account number, where only a portion of the number is visible, and the rest is replaced with a masking character.
Determining the portion of the account number to be masked and the portion to remain visible. This is the last few digits being visible while the rest are masked.
Using string manipulation functions to replace the specified portion of the account number with a masking character.
Returning the masked account number as the output.

-- =========================================================================================================================================
-- Author:		Mohammed belarrem
-- Description:	This function takes an account number and masks it using the predefined masks depending on the @UtilityCompanyName 
--
-- 02/06/2008	MOH		Create
-- 08/28/2009	MOH		Update:	Added more utility companies 
-- 06/10/2010	MOH		Update:	Corrected LIPA and National Grid 
-- 05/08/2012	MOH		Update:	Corrected Consolidated Electric 
-- 03/28/2014	MOH		Update:	Changed National Grid East mask
-- =========================================================================================================================================
CREATE FUNCTION [dbo].[MaskAccountNumber] 
(
	-- Add the parameters for the function here
	@AccountNumber acctnum, 
	@UtilityCompanySeqid int
)
RETURNS VARCHAR(20)
AS
BEGIN
	-- Declare the return variable here
	DECLARE @MaskedAccountNumber AS VARCHAR(20);

	
	SELECT @MaskedAccountNumber = 
	CASE 
		-- metro 00-0000
		WHEN @UtilityCompanySeqid = 1 THEN SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 1, 2)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 3, 4)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 7, 9)
		-- National Grid   000-00-0000-0
		WHEN @UtilityCompanySeqid = 2 THEN SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 1, 3)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 4, 2)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 6, 4)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 10, 1)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 11, 5) 
		-- Lipa 000-00-0000-0
		WHEN @UtilityCompanySeqid = 3 THEN SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 1, 3)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 4, 2)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 6, 4)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 10, 1)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 11, 5) 
		-- Consolidated Electric 000000000-00-0000
		WHEN @UtilityCompanySeqid = 4 THEN SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 1, 9)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 10, 2)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 12, 4)
		-- Orange & Rockland   00000-00000
		WHEN @UtilityCompanySeqid = 5 THEN SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 1, 5)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 6, 5)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 11, 5)
		-- Con Ed   00-0000-0000-0000-0 
        WHEN @UtilityCompanySeqid = 9 THEN SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 1, 2)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 3, 4)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 7, 4)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 11, 4)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 15, 1) 
		-- Central Hudson   0000-0000-00-0
		WHEN @UtilityCompanySeqid = 12 THEN SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 1, 4)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 5, 4)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 9, 2)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 11, 1)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 12, 4)   
		-- NYSEG  0000-0000-000
		WHEN @UtilityCompanySeqid = 13 THEN SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 1, 4)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 5, 4)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 9, 3)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 12, 4)
		-- National Grid   00000-00000-00000
		WHEN @UtilityCompanySeqid = 18 THEN SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 1, 5)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 6, 5)+ '-' + SUBSTRING(@AccountNumber, 11, 5)
        ELSE @AccountNumber
	END ;
	-- Return the result of the function
	RETURN @MaskedAccountNumber
END;
